result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert James Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Mistreat Animals, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 951.02.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA Sample.

Counseling deemed necessary.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert James Daniels in court with attorney Jeffery Joy.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2:47 p.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to ct 1, ct 2 dri, impose & stay 60 days jail, consecutive to other cases, 1 yr probation, no possession of animals, costs, DNA surcharge, counseling as deemed necessary. Stipulate to 1 day credit. Atty Joy and Def agree. Plea quest. reviewed. Plea to ct 1 - no contest. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in ct 2. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Joy satisfied. Court finds Def understands and plea freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts plea and finds Def guilty. Sentencing remarks by State. Court questions ability to order consecutive on jail. Sentencing remarks by Atty Joy. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. 60 days jail, imposed and stayed. If imposed, may serve in a different county, huber. Consecutive to any sentence already sentenced to serve. 1 yr probation, Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, no possession or ownership of any animals, counseling deemed necessary. Credit for 1 day if revoked.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Final pre-trial on March 27, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
Jury trial on April 12, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on January 23, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Jeffery Joy in court by phone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  History of case was discussed.  State requesting warrant, stay until 10-21-16 at 1:00 pm.  Response by Atty Joy.  Court will authorize warrant, $500.00 or body, adjacent counties.   Statement by Atty Joy.
Attorney Jeffery Joy by telephone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @3:28 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert James Daniels in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews court record.  Def was to contact an atty.  Def has contacted an atty.  Def contacted Atty Jeff Joy.   Def to appear with counsel, or appear in person.  Bond will continue  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert James Daniels in court, in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 1:19 pm.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty right options.  State gives bond recommendation.  Def. will hire private attorney. Def. gives address in Crandon. Court orders $500  Signature bond. Court vacates warrant.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
